The viral video shows a train carrying t: which is claimed to be a result of PM Modi's initiative to transport essential items during the coronavirus lockdown.
The video was shared on social media pla: emphasizing PM Modi's role in ensuring the availability of essential services.
Alt News: a fact-checking organization, analyzed the video using the InVid video verification tool and found that it was also uploaded on YouTube in 2013, indicating that the video is not recent.
The video is likely related to the India: s roll-on roll-off (RORO) service, which was started in 1999 by Konkan Railways and allows loaded trucks to be transported directly on railway wagons. Mumbai Mirror reported in 2018 that RORO service can carry 50 trucks at a time and save fuel consumption.
